entry.summary: USC and Code.org are sponsors of a Computer Science Workshop. Part of the purpose of the workshop is to provide a Curriculum Guide which is included in post.

entry.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

link.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

entry.summary: A discussion on Web APIs. This is about creating a Web API (Jokes), and creating API that retains data as long as the Web Server is running. This is done using List and Dictionaries as the backend. Ultimately, this example could be extended by adding a database to the backend. However, we are focussing on interaction of Frontend to Backend, this is called an Endpoint.

entry.title: Neo4J Graph Database Introduction
entry.summary: A description of the data, and then how to connect and query the database.

entry.title: Deployment Guide
